website_summaries.verdict: For small mulching jobs, this combination blower and mulcher offers a lightweight, portable way to vacuum up leaves and access hard-to-reach areas around the house.
pros: Powerful but lightweight Easily handles leaves and twigs
Can be quickly opened for cleaning or unclogging
Simple to switch from blower to vacuum for mulching
cons: Vacuum and mulcher can stir up a lot of dust
Leaves must be dry to mulch properly without clogging
Reports of plastic attachments breaking after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Fan Impeller exploded
customer_reviews.text: Within 30 minutes of use as a blower the aluminum fan/impeller exploded and split open the fan case with one piece exiting the blower. Inertia of fan as it came to a sudden stop caused blower to be snatched from my hand and it hit my thigh causing bruising. Scared to get a replacement because the impeller is made of cast aluminum and quite heavy. Caused a lot of damage to the blower caseing.
customer_reviews.author: PR User

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the vacuum function
customer_reviews.text: Got it today. LOVE the vacuum function. Doesn't pick up small rocks, just the leaves. Before/after photos show it does a decent job. Not perfect but good enough for me. Did suck up a bottle cap but spit it back out. Stops sucking when bag is full. I wish it was a little lighter but I also wish I had thinner thighs. A girl can dream...
customer_reviews.author: Vkolibel

customer_reviews.title: I would LIKE a replacement or my money refunded
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in 2016 and since used it about 6 times....I am a senior....and the product broke at the handle part. I took it to Home Depot and they can NOT fix it and it happens all the time with this product. I would LIKE a replacement or my money refunded. This should last longer than 6 uses.
customer_reviews.author: petlvraz

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only one hour
customer_reviews.text: I used the vac setting for about an hour after receiving item and it quit working all together. The only things I sucked up were grass trimmings. I'm gonna try to send it back but I am 1 day past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hetheriton

customer_reviews.title: Great for leaves, works best vacuuming from concrete
customer_reviews.text: I live in the desert, and my yards are of small rocks. The sidewalk is down the hill, so I don't use the blower very much. I mostly vac. It works well for the leaves and smaller twigs, especially those that are on the concrete or flagstone. It doesn't do well with the tiny Palo Verde petals. Its vacuum attachment works okay for what I use it for, and it doesn't pick up the rocks. It is light, I like the variable power settings, and my neighbor bought the same one after seeing mine. It would be nice if the vac had attachments like the blower, to get into tighter spaces below bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need to buy a special cord to use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it works well but I'm upset at the fact that you need to buy a special cord. So for something I got delivered, I need to go to the store to find a 2 wire or 3 wire polarized extension cord with a round base. This negates the $20 grounded extention cords I already have. A waste of time in my opinion. The manufacturer should include the cord.
customer_reviews.author: D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Failed even though hardly used
customer_reviews.text: Died a little over a year old and less than 4 uses. Update: Reached out to customer service and they are replacing it with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Anne MarieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product that quits after three uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leaf blower/vacuum a year and a half ago, but never took it out of the box for over a year. I used it several months ago and thought it did a decent job of vacuuming up the leaves, although it is heavier than I expected and was tiring to use except for short durations. For me it wasn’t easy to change to a blower, so I only used it for vacuuming. I used it for the third time this week and it worked for about ten minutes and then suddenly just quit. It is dead and useless now. Please be warned that this is an inferior product and a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: stick with gas or you will regret.
customer_reviews.text: OK if you have a extremely small yard. but for a average size and larger yards this will not do. the time you spend untangling the cord and dragging the heavy cord around you can clean 4 average sized yards with gas blower. even as a backup unit this is pain in the neck. as far as performance, it is very powerful blower and vacuum but these electric units are designed to take advantage of people that are temporarily p*** off at their gas unit. I just wish I had tried it before the return window closed now I'm going to have to buy another gas blower. this will not do. 4 star for unit and 1 star for electric.
customer_reviews.author: R. L

customer_reviews.title: this machine is awesome we received it 2 days after placing our order ...
customer_reviews.text: BUY IT!!! this machine is awesome we received it 2 days after placing our order the packaging was excellent looked brand new i was worried it would be a returned item and they just reshipped it, but it was new, it was very easy to put together, my husband had a spine surgery last year his back hurts sometimes and that's why we bought this and he loves it, we cut the grass and used the blower, then we picked up leafs using the other vacuum part, i highly recommend it, FYI when the vacuum collects the leafs it shredded them into the bag so it would fit more, very nice item :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Bought It
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use it and I like it. It sucks up leaves and twigs very well. Even clumps of wet leaves get sucked up. I have a bad back and anything that helps keep raking to a minimum is important to me. It's a dusty job but that's how every lawn vac I've ever owned is. The collection bag doesn't seem like it's going to be very durable so, if you like it, I'd recommend getting a replacement bag to have on hand when the bag wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Burritt

customer_reviews.title: THANK goodness for this lil guy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on an Amazon lightning deal. We have a BnD cordless to do our walks and driveway. The cordless did not do well removing leaves and particles on our river rocks and pea gravel on our property. Bought this fancy lil guy and couldn't be happier! It moves the leaves and twigs without moving and blowing gravel around. If you get right on top of the pea gravel, yes it will scatter the pebbles. At about a foot away seemed to be the perfect distance for lifting the leaves out. I recommend and would purchase as a gift for others.
customer_reviews.author: Sas' Mom

customer_reviews.title: The electric motor is very strong and puts out a great amount of air
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this sooner. Unboxing and putting it together is easier than 2nd grade math. The electric motor is very strong and puts out a great amount of air. The swiveling leafblaster attachment is awesome, it does alot of the work for you. Switching from blower to vacuum is a cinch, just use a flat blade screw driver through the slot on the back to push the release button and the bottom comes off. Then slide on the vac tube tube and bag. Looking forward for the rake attachment to come in for it. The only down side is it is rather loud, but a pair of ear plugs/muffs and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 8675309

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for general lawn needs
customer_reviews.text: used it for about an hour today in my backyard blowing around mostly dead grass. It did as good as to be expected. It is very powerful and about as noisy as my older black and decker blower. Pros: Powerful, Not too noisy, feels heavy duty, blower has cool attachment that swivels back and forth, not too heavy Cons: The mulch bag is a lot smaller then my older black and decker. A little hard to switch from blower to vacuum b/c you have to push in a little button with like a screwdriver or something small.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Built Like a Toy Not a Tool
customer_reviews.text: After 3 uses, the bag started to come apart. The sewing on the bag separated from the zipper and the zipper lost a tooth. This is my third Black & Decker Blower/Mulcher, the same problem on all 3. With these past problems, I was very careful with this one, it was worse. Also the vacuum tube is starting to loosen on the motor mount, stopping it from working. All this after 3 uses of about 45 minutes each. I bought the 2 year warranty because I've 2 others fail quickly. When it works it's a great machine, just make it better.
customer_reviews.author: James Patrick Lyons

customer_reviews.title: It sucks up most debris
customer_reviews.text: It does what I intended it to do. It's NOT comparable to a back pack blower. It just doesn't have the power. It works decent though. It sucks up most debris, except heavy stuff. The bag fills up real quick. It becomes a nuisance after several times. I wouldn't suggest using this for large jobs. I use it to clean up under some car ports and blowing off my deck. I wouldn't recommend this for actual yard work. If your looking for something to clean up quick and you have an outlet near, you cant beat this blower. Price isn't that bad either. Much cheaper on Amazon than retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: RBG 3

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my residential landscaping business for a yera now. The blower works great and the swivel attachment is awesome. removing the large mulcher tube from the small mulcher tube is improbably difficult but you don't have much of a reason to do it, other than storage and clearing a clog.... The vac doesn't work that great unless the stuff is VERY dry and lightweight... My model had a metal impeller; I don't now about current ones, as I have heard plastic in this model is not unheard of...
customer_reviews.author: Casey Sherman

customer_reviews.title: good for making leaf mulch
customer_reviews.text: I use this on it's vac and chop setting, which makes great leaf mulch for my beds. Compared to mowing and bagging leaves mowing is faster, but the leaf vac is more thorough and chops smaller making nicer mulch. It works very well with dry leaves, but damp to wet leaves clog the vac, eventually requiring you to take it apart a little and gouge out the wet mess. I haven't used any other leaf vacs, so this may well be the case for any brand or model.
customer_reviews.author: knitica

customer_reviews.title: just purchased a work blower/vac that was pure garbage. dust very where when using vacuum
customer_reviews.text: just purchased a work blower/vac that was pure garbage. dust very where when using vacuum. after two uses i tossed it and bought this unit. it a far better unit that makes minimal dust and is comfortable to use. i don't use it as a blower(i have a small gas unit that i use for that) which i pile the leaves and use then B&D to vacuum. makes quick work of piles of leaves but you will empty the bag a bit. no problem for me as it empties quick. would by again as long as it holds up. jimmy
customer_reviews.author: jimmy c

customer_reviews.title: GIGANTIC PIECE OF GARBAGE! I have been an amazon customer for many ...
customer_reviews.text: GIGANTIC PIECE OF GARBAGE! I have been an amazon customer for many years, I believe 18 or so. I have never written a review before and I have bought countless items. This product is underpowered and poorly designed. I don't understand how this product gets any positive reviews. Either they are paid reviews or mine is defective. Also, I waited several weeks before opening the box because I wasn't ready to use it. Well, I missed my opportunity to return this thing. Honestly, I going to put it out on the sidewalk with a free sign. Some people like anything that is free.
customer_reviews.author: Fun at the garbage dump

customer_reviews.title: It was OK at first, but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I'm done with Black + Decker. It was OK at first, but didn't last. When I say OK, I mean it is debatable whether it was faster then raking. Its strong suit was getting into shrubs and plants that are difficult to rake. I mostly used it as a vacuum. As a blower it was too weak. After two seasons the seals were already going bad, so it's even weaker and it doesn't chop the leaves as small. If you are looking for one of these, do yourself a favor, spend the extra money and get a good one. Then let me know which one you bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Guy

customer_reviews.title: This is the best tool I’ve ever owned for fall leaf cleanup
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool I’ve ever owned for fall leaf cleanup. I have a yard full of maple trees and each year I struggle with how to handle cleanup (I’m no ready to dish out $500 each year). This vacuum/blower is my buddy! Does a beautiful job on mulching ( I packed 100+ bags of mulched leaves). It picked up everything and never let me down. I will use it in the Spring as well!
customer_reviews.author: Bernice Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality blower
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the more expensive black and decker. It had a lower speed of which i didn't use. This one is the same except for this . This one also has a zip bag . The other did not and was hard to empty. Zip is great. It blows nicely. I use it on a arizona yard. All rock. I like the vacuum feature . It picks up and mulches the leaves and twigs.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Improved from leaf hog.
customer_reviews.text: My leaf hog took a beating for many years. I was always impressed. It finally had issues with the motor sparking and arcing. I mostly use the vacuum. This unit arrived today and I tried it on some considerable piles of oak leaves. I am impressed how well it mulches. I guess the plastic impeller of my old leaf hog was worn down over the years. This new vacuum was lighter, and a little quieter. It picked up about the same, maybe slightly better.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: ... of 5 stars because I think it would be better to have a little longer hose
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 4 out of 5 stars because I think it would be better to have a little longer hose. Not necessary for it to be so wide, but longer would be nice. This thing is kind of heavy after carrying for a bit, but the power in the blower and the vacuum is worth it (and gets 5 stars for that part). It mulches leaves into tiny particles, saving tons of room in the trash bag. The blower is intense and even blows marble size and double that size rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Hanno94

customer_reviews.title: Seriously powerful for a hand held
customer_reviews.text: This thing is no joke. Was hesitant to go back to corded Hand held because my last one wasn't very powerful and I have a half acre lot with a lot of foliage. But this was on sale for the same price as one days rental of a petrol back pack, so figured it was a good back up. Fully opened up (i.e. Without the small novel), this thing is POWERFUL. It's early in the season, but I doubt I'll bother with a petrol back pack this year now I have this. Cord is still a pain, but it's lighter and quieter than a back pack, and probably just as powerful.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum with a couple of quirks.
customer_reviews.text: It picks up really well, sometimes too well. Occasionally, it picks up a pine cone and the pine cone gets stuck in front of the impeller causing a clog. It doesn't seem to mind if the leaves are a little wet. It's good for getting under bushes, too. The bag is kind of awkward and small, though. It would be better if the bag were deeper with the zipper on the bottom, rather than on the back. That would make it easier to empty without needing to lift the vacuum unit up. We bought it for the vacuum, not the blower.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Mine came broken. The vacuum will not work because the device is missing the part to attach it. I've tried everything to connect them together, but it doesn't work. I can use it to BLOW, but not to suck. That's one of the reasons I got this in the first place. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom n Debbie Young

customer_reviews.title: I love using the blower to get concrete areas clear
customer_reviews.text: works well for what I need it for. I love using the blower to get concrete areas clear.. The vacuum is great around fencing area. I would not suggest using it to do a big job like mulching your whole yard because it would be time consuming to keep emptying bag. Just adding that last comment in from personal experience. Also try not to suck up wood chips\mulch, doesn't like it and makes a loud sound.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great Corded Blower Vac!  I love mine!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight for someone like me who is not very strong....works great! Beats raking leaves! And after a burst hose on the old washing machine in my basement í used our shop vac to suck up the water but things were still damp....until í spotted my Black&Decker blower/vac! Worked like a giant hairdryer and dried everything completely! No mold no mildew no musty smell....Black&Decker to the rescue again!
customer_reviews.author: NanaTia

customer_reviews.title: FAR better than a TORO!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT unit! I had a Toro that finally died. Replaced it with this B&D model and it’ss FAR better than the Toro, at 1/3 to 1/2 the price!!!! I used it mainly (99%) for mulching Magnolia leaves and large Viburnam leaves. The Toro was just ok. Couldn't Use the entire tube as there wadn’t Enough suction to pull the big leaves all the way up. After an hour of being stooped over, my back was killing me! The B& D has plenty of sucking with the full tube! Big leaves are NO PROBLEM! And, the METAL blade/impeller is REPLACEABLE where the Toro’s was not. I am SOLD on this B& D BV5600!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Belisle

customer_reviews.title: Sucks Just Right: Strong Enough for Leaves, but not Gravel
customer_reviews.text: This is the only yard vacuum that I've ever owned, so I cannot compare it to others. But, for the money, this is one of the best tool investments I've ever made. It turns hours of raking into 20 minutes of vacuuming. On high, the suction is strong enough to suck in leaves, but not strong enough to suck in gravel from the alley. That's perfect. It has also made trimming yew bushes easier. You can use it to suck the clipping out of the bush. I've also been using it to suck fallen tree leaves off of lavender cotton (santolina gray).
customer_reviews.author: New Old North Columbus

customer_reviews.title: Yay, no more raking leaves!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! Basically, pulled it out of the box and started using it. We have a couple big maple like trees that lose their leaves like crazy in the fall. It easily sucks them up and mulches them and drops the mulch in a bag. The bag seems to hold quite a bit so you don't have to stop too often to dump. It is light enough to be able to pick up and do a quick pick up without much exertion. I think he actually has some fun with this thing. Plus, no raking is pretty sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: My Wife's 'BFG'
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to use when she sucks up the acorns in our backyard. Easy for her to handle and does a great job both as a vacuum and yard 'stuff' blower.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Bags, fall apart easily.
customer_reviews.text: This leaf vac is nice and powerful for sucking up leave, but the bag is made out of cloths so cheap that a sharp leaf fragment will tear right through it with ease. I have to buy mine a new bag about every six months and those things are not cheap. I suppose this inst a problem if you only intend to use it in leaf blowing mode
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Magee

customer_reviews.title: Leaf Blower, Vacuum, and Pest Control
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower/vacuum works great. I needed a solution not just for the large amount of leafs on my property but also to control a Jadera Bug (aka Box Elder or Red Shoulder Bug) infestation. No insecticide that I’ve tried has worked, and each year the number of bugs seemed to increase exponentially. Not this year, as I simply used the vacuum feature to get rid of those annoying bugs and their food source with very little effort or pesticides. To make it even easier I used the optional vacuum leaf collection system.
customer_reviews.author: Petees

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This thing has saved me what normally takes about 30-45 minutes to manually sweep, rake, and collect leaves that fall on my patio to sucking everything up in one pass. Now takes me 5 minutes to do both balcony's! Couldn't be happier with this purchase. There are two power levels on this blower and the first level was more than enough for what I need. I would recommend ear plugs when operating.
customer_reviews.author: The Shark

customer_reviews.title: Worse than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is, apparently, one of the stronger blowers out there. And it's nothing compared to a gas blower, and I mean literally nothing. Good enough for small household jobs, but it'll still give you issues with serious yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great mulcher ok blower
customer_reviews.text: Great item, specifically the mulcher. If mulches leave and shrubs no problem. I love how it also gathers it. The leaf blower on the other hand is weaker compared to my 10 year old black and decker leaf blower. My old one is as strong as some of the commercial ones,though this one will get the job done no problem .
customer_reviews.author: kinggambit

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product and the metal blades has ensure this product ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and the metal blades has ensure this product last because I have sucked up a few rocks that are in the leave bundles. If you are allergic I'd recommend you use a face mask since this creates a fine dust from the leaf shredding. This definitely reduces the amount of paper bags needed but becomes a chore if you have a lot of leaves because you'll have to constantly empty it. Best to use this when the leaves are dried out for a while so they shredded easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sam Dog

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall but does have one annoying design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Works well, blower not as powerful as a gas blower but it does a pretty good job and I haven't found a gas model that has the vacuum feature which I use a lot in my pool area and in my flower gardens / plant areas against my foundation and fenced in areas. My only complaint is the rotary switch which is located right under the handle, I wear gloves and frequently end up turning the switch whenever I am switching hands, it's definitely a bit annoying at times; thus, 4 rather than 5 stars. Not sure what the mechanical engineer was thinking, I doubt they field tested this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dgauv

customer_reviews.title: This blower works fine for my intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: This blower works fine for my intended purpose, which is blowing out my courtyard and driveway. The vacuum side is a bit difficult to assemble and the suction is not great, so I don't bother with that side, which was disappointing. Within the first month it blew up and I took it to a local repair shop who contacted B & D and the company exchanged it. We are not sure if it was my extension cord or the blower itself, but the company stood behind their product and I was pleasantly surprised and impressed. The second one has worked flawlessly (on a new extension cord). If and when this one quits I will get a third one.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful blower vac. I can't wait to use it this fall. Only one negative comment on this product. You have to use a screw driver to push in the release button to remove the blade cover in order to convert to vacuum mode. I will give it a good test come fall when the leaves pile up. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Megal

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I don't know how many of you expect this thing to last for years, but let's get real....things just don't last like they used to. Anyway, for the price, this is a great tool for your yardwork. Very good suction and blowing power....and this has a metal blade as opposed to plastic, like some other brands. I would even say that this would be worth buying one every year because it works so well, if it turns out to be an annual disposable product.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Don't count on it to pick up sweet gum balls or pine cones as a vaccum. It won't. However, I do love the fact that it mulches the leaves so small that I can then use them to mulch around in my garden. It's not really heavy, although the bag can become heavy when it's completely full. My 11 year old daughter regularly uses it. The blower works as expected. Have been using it regularly for several months now.
customer_reviews.author: criss

customer_reviews.title: Top notch quality tool
customer_reviews.text: It is powerful and efficient. It is more heavy than I expected. I am a senior woman with only average strength. I find it easier to maneuver as a blower. If I have to use it as a vacuum for any extended time, I tire and have to stop; therefore, I avoid using it as a vacuum, which often defeats my initial reason for purchasing it. Still, I am keeping it for times when I can pace myself/can't put off clearing yard/patio debris any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Little Old Lady in Sac

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this as much as the older design
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this as much as the older design. I have a model that's close to 10 years old. Still works, but is getting worn so thought I would get this as a replacement. It's useless with leaves that are a little wet and clogs very easily. Leaves have to be perfectly dry for this to work as intended. I had to go back to my old machine to finish the yard since I needed to get the leaves off the lawn before worse weather arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Vu N.

customer_reviews.title: I was a TOTAL SKEPTIC on this...But....
customer_reviews.text: I was a TOTAL SKEPTIC on this... I hate to say it, but I haven't trusted Black and Decker brand for years... And the price of $75.00 seem low to me for a quality blower, vacuum and mulcher combo with all the attachments.... This is probably the best $75.00 tool I've purchased in a very long time.. I've had it for about 3 months and I really am impressed every time I use it...
customer_reviews.author: Daveh777

customer_reviews.title: Weak AF
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. I guess I should have figured that out when they didn't list CFM. This takes me forever to clean up my yard. I am going to buy a new blower today as I will make up the difference in cost in time that I am wasting in a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: someone is lying!
customer_reviews.text: had a Toro, though I would try a Black and Decker as they claim greater CFM. Someone is not telling the truth. This blower takes me twice as long to clean up the yard as with the Toro. Air flow is about half, even though Black and Decker claims it is greater. It is also much, much louder. I am going to go buy another Toro.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent shopper

customer_reviews.title: There's no shoulder strap to carry the power head. ...
customer_reviews.text: There's no shoulder strap to carry the power head. You have to muscle the thing as you go. Also, as bag fills it becomes dead weight. You can suspend it on your shoulder with a strap that's included that tends to slip unless you loop it over your head to the opposite should.. Removing a full bag to empty it takes some jiggling and pulling. The vacuum tube tends to wad big leaves (sycamore) and get jammed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kane

customer_reviews.title: We live in the canopy of living oaks. This ...
customer_reviews.text: We live in the canopy of living oaks. This is the first blower/vacuum to get the job done! This saves me 70% of the normal time needed to sweep and compost. The bagging feature provides for some shredding and the leaves take up so much less room after shred. The device can create lots of dust, so be ready for a mask, hat and long sleeve task, followed by a deep scrub in the shower. The only down side is the zipper on the bag. As soon as it fills the first time, dust can restrict movement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: Not very effective as a vacuum/mulcher. The blowing action isn't as good as their dedicated blower. As a vacuum, it only can suck in a small area and is very loud. As a mulcher, it works OK as long as the leaves are completely and totally dry - anything else will clog. This just isn't powerful enough to rely on to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Less Mess, Quick Pick Up
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected to pick up leaves around my flowerbeds and koi pond. Hoping this fall to keep more leaves off of the leaf net and thus out of the pond as they still seem to sneak in there. The con I found was that the bag allowed a bit of dust to puff out, as it is porous to allow for adequate vacuuming. However, I love that it is electric, and I don't have to mess with a gas-powered engine or 2 cycle fuel/oil mix.
customer_reviews.author: LittleKel

customer_reviews.title: ERMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself time. This thing is awesome. I feel like such a sucker (no pun intended) for raking and bagging by hand all these years. Some reviews noted breakage due to a plastic impeller, but mine was metal, so looks like that has been upgraded. Word of advice - if pollen or dust bothers you, might want to get some good eye protection and face mask. The first time I used this was sucking up oak leaves(and pollen) - worked great and saved me tons of time, but basically vaporized the pollen and made my allergies go crazy.
customer_reviews.author: MFamily

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and effective
customer_reviews.text: I chose a corded model because I wanted a more powerful unit and I don't regret it. While it doubles as a blower, I keep it configured as a vac. Most of the debris in my yard is small (mesquite and palo verde), but some of it is hard. This unit chops through everything and the bag is pretty roomy. My only criticism is that it gets heavy after a while, but that's understandable.
customer_reviews.author: Chalchiuhtlicue

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap! I never thought I'd get excited about a ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap! I never thought I'd get excited about a leaf blower/vac! Whoever came up with the wiggly bit at the end of the blower attachment needs a big fat bonus! Amazing how well it gets up the stubborn leaves that are stuck to the ground and never want to budge. And the noise level is well below that of other blower/vacs. I never had to use the second power setting once, and I was dealing with a lot of wet leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best product I have purchased in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. I cleaned up an area of the yard I had been putting off forever - it was a breeze. I opened it about 15 minutes after it arrived, put it together in about 5 minutes and was off and running. I am a 62 year old woman and I could handle it with ease. The amount of debris it mulched was just amazing. I would definitely give this 5 stars and suggest it for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of My Favorite Tools
customer_reviews.text: Let's just get this straight, I hate this job....cleaning and mulching the patio. I am somewhat disabled at this point, but can manage this tool. It has changed my life. I don't even think if I did manage to break it at this point, that I wouldn't just order a new one. But it's already taken a beating from me...picking up nails from a house project, stones from our French drains....and it keeps ticking, blows off the mower, entire garage and tools so very quick. Great Product! If they could reduce the dust that gets thru the bag without disposables...I think that would be a plus.....but other than that, I have no complaints at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: 2 great tools in one box.
customer_reviews.text: This B&D BV5600 is a wonderful and handy tool for blowing your leaves,dirt away or using the suction unit to vac the leaves. It shreds maple leaves into small pieces, it has a metal fan instead of a plastic witch gets deformed from all the shredding. It's so powerful on high that I picked up stones and it didn't do any damage, the plastic fans would chip. I've had both, It's 2 tools in one, and very powerful low and Hi speed. Very glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Handee

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The Black and Decker BV5600 is a great blower and mulcher combination unit. This has a couple of power settings depending on what job you are doing but seems to be able to handle all the jobs as well. I even mulched without using the storage bad as to just add compost back into the area but giving it a much cleaner look compared to leaves everywhere. The nice thing is that once you are done mulching you can easily change out a few pieces and you have a strong blower to clean off any places that are not supposed to be covered!
customer_reviews.author: D&R

customer_reviews.title: Good as a blower
customer_reviews.text: Good as a blower, but as a Vacuum it take forever to pick up you leafs. It works better with very small leafs, but if you leafs are mid size or bigger it can only suck 2 or 3 at at time, making it useless for yard work. It work on a small area like the side of your house or something like that. I do not recommend this if you have a backyard with a lot of trees.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and well built blower and vacuum. My third one. I use it several times a week. The mulching of plant material and leaves is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High hopes, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product for this year's fall leaves season. I wash crushed when it was slower than hand bagging. Instead, just mulch with mower for faster leaf clean up. In theory, decent job if your too old and slow. But if you have a big yard don't waste your time. You will be frustrated when it clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: It'll Do the Job
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with loose leaves. I had to rake up matted leaves. The mulch product is very satisfactory. I only plan to mulch, not use as a blower. It's astonishingly loud and very dusty. The booklet says use mask, goggles, and hearing protection. Believe me, I will.
customer_reviews.author: singing grandma

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and awkward
customer_reviews.text: Did not love this. I usually like Black and decker products but this one didn't measure up. I found heavier than my last blower/vac. I will say i use mine primarily for sucking up leaves. I found the suction tube heavy, too big and awkward. The strap to hold the bag was too short and flimsy. I ended up going with the Toro and it was a much better choice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very powerful. Two speeds are very useful. The oscillating leaf blower attachment is magic. The vacuum/leaf mulching function works very well, I suspect due to the metal fan blades, and produces leaf bits around 1/4" in size, yet it did not suck up small stones as I had feared. Assembly and conversion from one mode to another was easy/quick. Durability is TBD, but a couple of hours of constant use revealed no glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Pace

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: powerful. Metal blades is a huge plus, this is in fact to replace my older unit that the plastic blades broke. Its not super convenient to swap back and forth between vacuum and blower mode (need to push the tab with a flathead screwdriver) but i just use as vac so it doesn't mater,
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: It blows well but doesn't vacuum/mulch as well as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: It blows well but doesn't vacuum/mulch as well as I'd hoped. I bought it along with the $30 kit to mulch into trash cans but the vacuum/mulcher doesn't pick up big oak leaves very well. If you blow the leaves into a pile and try to mulch into the trash cans, the big oak leaves just clog the mouth of the pickup tube. If you try to vacuum straight off the lawn into the trash can, you'll be taking all day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D

customer_reviews.title: Hate Leaves!
customer_reviews.text: Thank God for this machine! I Hate Leaves, I hate picking them up, I hate everything about them. And now, because of this little gadget, I pick them up and mulch them in no time. One suggestion I would give to the buyer, don't wear a nice shirt while using it because the dust from the bag no only makes you a dirty mess, but your clothes get nasty too.
customer_reviews.author: CARRIE

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My first electric leaf blower Gets the job done and what I expected it too. The nose attachments are nice. One in which you don't have to go side to side physically, it comes with a swivel that dies that for you. Only complaint, probably a deficit but the wire holder on the back where you would loop an extention cord, no way to loop it on other than zip tie because it's a solid piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: This vac/blower combination is perfect. Although I don't use the blower, the vacuum option is perfect for picking up leaves, even on top of bark. The unit mulches the leaves as they go through the process of being vacuumed. There is a big range of suction power so that picking up wet leaves is possible. I have used mine for two years trouble free. My latest purchase was for a sixteen unit townhouse setting and it has worked trouble free since we received it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to vacuum the endless volume of leaves in our front yard. Raking wasn't efficient. It worked quite well for me. It is powerful and picks up everything. It did need to be emptied several times and it did blow some dust out the bag. My husband thought I was waisting my money until he used it to blow the leaves instead of vacuuming them. He was impressed at the power and now he blows the leaves! I think this was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: simple

customer_reviews.title: different doesnt always mean better
customer_reviews.text: still prefer my 2500 and its replaceable plastic impeller,with inline handle design , it was lighter too . since its no longer available the5600 gets the job done . having a low speed is nice , the narrow blower housing plugs easier when mulching damp stuff.its ok I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: brian j lawson

customer_reviews.title: Vacuums ok but dust is over the top
customer_reviews.text: Well, it works as a vacuum ok (I haven't tried the blower setting yet). As previous reviewers noted, it has a horrible dust creation problem after it mulches into the bag ... I took a shower after using it and the amount of dirt in my nostrils was ridiculous. So, either wear a filter mask or try to get a better collection bag that actually has a filter.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Dad

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use in vacuum mode to keep our patio clear. It has to be aimed close at the debris, but it does pick them up and chop them. It is so light and easy that my wife does the patio most times, an undocumented benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing Sprit

customer_reviews.title: Never rake leaves again!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so awesome. It is quite loud but it does a great job of sucking up leaves and twigs and pulverizing them into dust. Love that I can even change speeds to pull up leaves in planter beds without sucking up all the dirt. One of my favorite yard tools and a great deal for $50!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good. I love the mulching feature as it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. I love the mulching feature as it makes it so much easier to suck up leaves versus blow them all over the yard. I have found that it’s easier to just leave the leaves where they lie and suck them up from there versus try to rake them in a pile. I have tons of leaves in my yard during the fall months and this thing really saved me so much time. I loved it so much that I bought one for my mom.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy Z

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: This blower/vacuum does the job very well. Because it is a mulcher, it is heavier than a only leaf blower, so beware if you have any back problems. However, this blower/mulcher is a really good buy - except for one small issue; the mulching bag is too small for me. I bought a Black & Decker BV-006 Blower/Vacuum Leaf Collection System to go with this and they work like a charm together.
customer_reviews.author: T. McTier

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: I used the B&D BV5600 about 4times then it stopped working. The power switch will not work. While it was working, it worked better as a vacuum/mulcher than as a blower. The instructions for assembly are moderately clear. I haven't given up hope on this yard tool yet. Will have to take it apart and see if I can find anything that might be plugging it up somewhere. In the meantime, all the leaves have already fallen, been racked up by hand and disposed of in green waste. Better luck in the fall.
customer_reviews.author: vitty

customer_reviews.title: works great. Sucks and blows harder than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: works great. Sucks and blows harder than I thought it would. My main usecase for this tool is that my mower struggles to bag grass. Takes forever. But If I have it shoot out the side and then come back and suck it up with this it works incredibly well. It compacts the grass much more effectively than the mower. It's amazing...
customer_reviews.author: Jason Case

customer_reviews.title: It does a good job blowing and vacuuming leaves though which is why ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to vacuum up acorns in my backyard. A lot of people say it should be able to handle sucking them up however it is not strong enough. It does a good job blowing and vacuuming leaves though which is why I’m keeping it. Its good enough for the price but nothing fancy.
customer_reviews.author: Garypmjr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine works great does what its suppose to.The motor has two speeds which is a plus if you want to cut the power in areas where you don't need to much suction or blowing.Its easy to use and empty the leaves .The metal impeller is built heavy duty and chops up leaves and twigs small.I suggest waring a dust mask.You have to stay a couple of inches off stones and rocks otherwise they will get sucked up into tube.I will recommend this product and seller to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Smaller Yard.
customer_reviews.text: Blower works great! The mulching function doesn't work as well. I've had to take it apart and clean it out a few times. One time was because of wet leaves/grass. I learned quickly not to do that. I have a smaller yard, so this works perfect. If the yard was bigger or had more debris I would upgrade to something a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle E Smith

customer_reviews.title: Extremely light weight and easy to attach the long tube thing now I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely light weight and easy to attach the long tube thing now I don't have to wait on my husband I can blow the carport and drive way off myself
customer_reviews.author: SharShar

customer_reviews.title: This bad boy turned my normal 4-5 hour raking job into ...
customer_reviews.text: As a first time home owner. I spent my first year raking for hours. This bad boy turned my normal 4-5 hour raking job into 1.5 hours of work. And saved my back! Honestly I feel like I should have paid more for this. Smartest buy for the yard yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Gets the job done just right. I've had a similar product before and this one is better because it has a stronger fan (metal blades). It's fairly heavy when set up for vacuuming, even with the shoulder strap on the bag, so be prepared for a bit of a workout. It does do an excellent job of vacuuming up leaves and grass clippings, however. Great bag design too - it doesn't start letting out mulch when you disconnect it from the machine.
customer_reviews.author: John Seale

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used the mulch/vac yet but I use the ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the mulch/vac yet but I use the blower to clean up my lawn tractor after every mow. Also use to blow rocks out the carport and leaves off of the deck. Has plenty of power, seems well built.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Blower will not turn on.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great for blowing leaves and for mulching leaves used it twice. Took it out today to do some cleaning up in the yard, and it will not turn on. Changed the cord, changed the Outlet it will not turn on. Again only the third time I tried to use it.
customer_reviews.author: cindyfitch

customer_reviews.title: Love this blower!
customer_reviews.text: This is what I bought myself with my Amazon birthday giftcard last year. The best present ever! When sweeping our parkway, I prefer a broom. I love basic brooms! BUT when clearing our pavers in the backyard where there are leaves trapped in the surrounding stacked rocks, the blower does an amazing and quick job. We tried the vacuum and found it to be too much trouble.... but the blower... YES!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Arnett

customer_reviews.title: This mulcher was working great..
customer_reviews.text: This mulcher was working great....for the first 20 mimutes. It did have what I thought was a small vibration, but this was the first time I used a mulcher. It simply stopped working without any warning. With all the great reviews, I think I may have received a bad unit. I returned it to Amazon and will be ordering a BV6600 which has a larger bag and the variable switch.
customer_reviews.author: seasons19

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mulcher
customer_reviews.text: Well, I always try to buy Black & Decker products. This one is a little over rated. It clogs up really easy and it gets very heavy when the bag is full. As for "mulching 16 bags of mulch into 1" Absolutely no way. I have pecan trees and lots of leaves, small sticks, and pecans. I hope it lasts. You could possibly rake and pick up the leaves but it hurts my back to do all the bending. So in closing I will continue to use this. Maybe next year will be easier it I do it in stages. I just hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: amazoncrazy

customer_reviews.title: Does an adequate job, but I had expected a ...
customer_reviews.text: Does an adequate job, but I had expected a bit more sucking strength. I have to be basically skimming the ground before it will pick up the oak leaves. Also, the cord is constantly coming unplugged--don't know if this is because I am left-handed and holding it 'backwards' or if this happens to everyone with irritating regularity, but it is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this product, however I am giving it a low review becait only lasted a year and a half before it stopped working. The suction no longer works on it. I guess I expected it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: tacljones

customer_reviews.title: Defective....too late to return it.
customer_reviews.text: I rec'd this for Christmas ( it was what I asked for.. :) ) But who needs a leaf blower in the dead of winter? I opened it last week, put it together, and it doesn't work. But my return window was only 30 days...so now I'm stuck with a leaf blower that doesn't work. And although it's under warranty, I'm the one who pays for return shipping. Super disappointed. Buyer beware...and at the very least, put it together AS SOON AS IT ARRIVES in case yours is a lemon too.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Blower is good, vacuum needs to go back to engineering
customer_reviews.text: Like it, works good as a blower. As a vacuum, its cumbersome to attach, noisy and doesn't really do a good job of getting leaves up especially in rocks. I bought it for the blower portion anyway, and the price was acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: On full power it still had trouble getting leaves out of the grass. Once I finally had a pile, and switched over to the vacuum, it stopped dead after 5 minutes. After checking the power cord and making sure the fan spun freely, i packed it back on the box and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: J Cook

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Using this to clean oak leaves from my roof and gutters. Can be a little unwieldy going up and down a ladder. It does an admirable job with even damp leaves. Can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RebDo

customer_reviews.title: I used it to pick up large laurel leaves and it turned 3 garbage bags full of leaves into less than half
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful blower/vac. I used it to pick up large laurel leaves and it turned 3 garbage bags full of leaves into less than half. The fan is metal, which is important when you suck up a rock or large pieces of wood. My only problem with the vac is the stunning amount of dust it throws into the air. I will start using a face mask because of the dirt thrown up. I don't think this is a defect, it is just the nature of sucking up dirt and leaves. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: mathfordragons

customer_reviews.title: Not good for smaller users or mixed leaves
customer_reviews.text: This was too heavy and uncomfortable in my small female hand--grip too wide--plus to use the mulch feature (which is what makes heavy) you have to have clean pile leaves--no srones, sticks, cones. Which makes it worthless for me, so I returned. But could be fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: Crtclthinkr

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER BV5600 High Performance Blower/Vac/Mulcher
product_meta.description: The BLACK & DECKER BV5600 High Performance Blower/Vac/Mulcher features a 250 mph blower that blows through leaves and debris with ease. This unit is 50% Quieter for less noise during blowing (Maximum noise level compared to Black & Decker model LH4500 utilizing EN ISO 3744 sound measurement test procedure). A high impact metal fan prevents clogging when mulching, while grinding up to 16 bags of mulch down to one. It also has 2 Speed selections for flower beds and powerful enough for matted leaves. The Leaf blaster pivoting action turbo nozzle loosens leaves and debris for faster clean up and the 12 amp motor 3-in-1 blower, vacuum and mulcher keeps the yard neat and tidy. This system has a built-in cord retainer which keeps the extension in place and plugged in for uninterrupted use. This blower is ideal for clearing driveways, sidewalks, decks and garages of debris and fall leaves from yard and the heavy-duty vacuum is ideal for vacuuming leaves, grass clippings, twigs, pine needles and other lawn debris. Includes: (1) BV5600 Motor Head, (1) LEAFBLASTER Nozzle, (1) Concentrator, (1) Blow Tube, (1) Vacuum Tube and Bag Assembly.
feature_bullets: The 12 amp motor operates a 3 in 1 blower, vacuum and mulcher all in one
Can grind up to 16 bags of mulch down to one
Easy change between vacuum and blower, Decibel : 68 dBA
2 Speed selections for flower beds and powerful enough for matted leaves

Air Speed: 180/250 mph; Bag: 1.5 Bushels; Decibels: 68 dBA; Included Components: BV5600 12 Amp Blower Vac, (1) Blow Tube, (1) Vacuum Tube, (1) Collection bag, LEAFBLASTER(TM) Nozzle; Mulch Ratio: 16:1; Power Source: Electric; Type: Blower Vac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,673 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
